body:
We ran second last week. Bridesmaid, again. Patrick Cantlay, the sixth best golfer in the world according to our **[World Golf Rankings](https://www.betrefinery.com/golf-betting/world-golf-rankings)**, just didn't get there. But that's betting. There's always another day, and this week that mean's the Farmers Insurance Open at the gorgeous Torrey Pines South Course. So let's fire up the Model and find our **Farmers Insurance picks**. - - - ## **2021 Farmers Insurance Outputs** Here are the outputs from our Model. Details on how it was built are down the bottom of the page.
Now, the next step is comparing these outputs vs the market. Until our odds comparison is ready, we use **[Odds Boom](https://www.oddsboom.com/golf/futures/2232-farmers-insurance-open/)**. - - - ## **Farmers Insurance Open Picks** Coming soon. - - -
**WANT GREAT GOLF ODDS? JOIN POINTSBET**
- - - ## **Why Should I Care About Your Model?** Glad you asked. Firstly, our chief data scientist is no joke. He makes a healthy living by betting off his sports models. His most recent, our golf model, uses the last 15 years of data to produce win predictions for PGA tournaments. The model can be broken down into three stages: 1. **Historic score adjustment** Firstly, historic golf scores are adjusted to account for varying course difficulty and conditions on the day. For example a "-2" on a certain course/day combination may be an average score but on another course/day combination it might be a great score due to the course being more difficult and/or unfavorable conditions. This adjustment is necessary so that we can compare players on a like for like basis. 2. **Score prediction** We then create features using the adjusted historic scores and run a few machine learning algorithms on top of these, weighting each equally. These provide an accurate prediction for the most likely score that a player will achieve on an average course in the future. 3. **Simulation** Using these future score predictions, for a given tournament we can then simulate each player's score using their own score distribution to come up with win percentages and fair odds for each player in a tournament. - - - ## **More Golf Betting Expertise** If you love betting on golf like us, check out our **[Top 50 World Golf Rankings](https://www.betrefinery.com/golf-betting/world-golf-rankings)**. We update them every week. Plus we have a **[How To Bet On Golf Guide](https://www.betrefinery.com/golf-betting/how-to-bet-on-golf)** that we think you'll love too. Whilst we might play off 22 when we go around the course, our golf betting is off scratch. - - - **Want our weekly golf predictions in your inbox?** **Sign up for the Wednesday email.** **We promise it's worth your time.**
title: Farmers Insurance Picks: Tony The Tiger
